Navigate between sections by swiping left or right or using the navigation drawer.

Self motivated and hard working individual looking to change careers.
Having achieved a 2.1 honours degree in information technology and computing, along with other qualifications, whilst working full time helped me improve qualities such as time management, dedication, ambition and commitment.
Recently made redundant, due to falling orders, my job was as a quality auditor for Sanoh UK, a parts supplier for the automotive industry. Since then I have continued to study, via free online courses, and create apps for Android.
I am looking to work in the areas of computing and IT. My main area of expertise is programming. This was the most challenging and enjoyable aspect of my studies.

Sanoh UK Manufacturing Ltd
Quality Auditor (August 2008 – March 2019)
Sanoh produces brake and fuel pipes for the automotive industry. As a quality auditor (and as part of the quality team) it was my responsibility to ensure that the companies quality procedures were being maintained and carried out properly.

Skills acquired through work:
  • Working within the quality department has given me a keen eye for detail.
  • Take precise measurements, using various tools, to ensure parts are within customer specifications.
  • Be a good communicator and be approachable.
  • To work independently using initiative, along with problem solving skills, when investigating potential quality issues.
  • Work effectively as part of the quality team.

CV App:
This is a mobile version of my CV. It is broken down into sections that the user can get to by either, swiping between screens, or using the navigation drawer. A settings popup menu allows the user to increase or decrease the text size. There is also a FAB button that, when tapped, brings up a speed dial with links to GitHub, LinkedIn and my email.
Google Play/GitHub

Earthquake App:
Uses Google maps to show recent earthquakes. The earthquake data is obtained via the United States Geological Survey website. The app parses the JSON data adding markers to the map. Tapping a marker will bring up further info on the earthquake via a window. When this is tapped the webpage for the earthquake is displayed via the users default browser.
Google Play/GitHub

The Computing and IT Project:
My final year of studying with the OU included the Computing And IT Project. The study area was largely left up to the student. I chose to write apps for Android using Java.
The basic idea was to build two apps. These would test the idea that personal navigation could be done via a phones vibration function.
Programming these apps involved a lot of research into programming for Android. The second app also used Google maps.
As well as programming, the final report also contained use cases, state machine diagram, activity diagram, code beautification and descriptions of how the code was created via prototyping (Scope/Design, Notes on the programming, Testing).
The final report can be found here.
Both apps are on GitHub. Also a readme file that goes into more detail on both apps.

One of my main interests is in technology and gadgets. Keeping up to date with the world of technology is a passion.
I also enjoy dancing, specifically Le Roc (French jive). I have previously taught and still enjoy going to dances and classes.
